block.p: Diane Marie Weathers and Ronald Smothers were married yesterday at Riverside Church in Manhattan. The Rev. James A. Forbes Jr. performed the nondenominational ceremony.

The bride, who will continue to use her name professionally, is a senior editor at Redbook magazine in Manhattan. She graduated from Syracuse University. She is the daughter of Harriet Weathers of Towson, Md., and the stepdaughter of the late Thomas Jones. Her mother, who is retired, was a social worker in Manhattan and Brooklyn for the City Department of Social Services and later in Wurzburg, Germany, for the United States Defense Department. The bride's stepfather owned the Oak Street Barber Shop, which was in East Orange, N.J.

The bridegroom is a reporter in the Newark bureau of The New York Times. He graduated from Hobart College. He is the son of Emily M. Smothers of Washington and the late Warren Smothers. His mother, who is retired, was a kindergarten teacher at Joshua R. Giddings Elementary School, which was in Washington. His father owned Apex Janitorial Services, which was in Washington. The bridegroom's previous marriage ended in divorce.
